column4: hi, is this the channel i can ask about network hardware not playing nice with ubuntu?
check the output of dmesg when you insert it, see what it is recognized as. What kind of card is it?
i woudn't've thought to do that, i'm really new to linux so i've been trying to follow along on the forums as best as i could
no problem, what kind of card is it?
belkin f5d7011 pcmcia card that uses the broadcom chipset from what i read
oh its a wireless card, hrmm ... have you tried on the livecd? did it work then?
I bought the card after installing ubuntu on the system
heh i thought it would work right out of the box
if you give me about ... 4 hours, I will have a better answer for you (that's how long it will take to rebuild my laptop) :P
well first thing we have to make sure is that its being detected.
take the card out, plug it in. Then, open a terminal window and type tail /var/log/messages -- and then go to pastebin.com and paste the results there.
heh thats a nifty website, but yea not sure what all that means
able to make sense from the mess i pasted?
